segments.pli: Āyasmā rādho yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ rādhaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “Pariññeyye ca, rādha, dhamme desessāmi pariññañca pariññātāviṃ puggalañca.
segments.en: “Rādha, I will teach you the things that should be completely understood, complete understanding, and the person who has completely understood.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā rādho bhagavato paccassosi.

segments.en: “And what things should be completely understood?

segments.pli: Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, pariññeyyo dhammo, vedanā pariññeyyo dhammo, saññā pariññeyyo dhammo, saṅkhārā pariññeyyo dhammo, viññāṇaṃ pariññeyyo dhammo.
segments.en: Form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
These are called the things that should be completely understood.

segments.pli: Yo kho, rādha, rāgakkhayo dosakkhayo mohakkhayo—
segments.en: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
And what is the person who has completely understood?
It should be said: a perfected one,
the venerable of such and such name and clan.
This is called the person who has completely understood.”

suttaplex.blurb: The aggregates are to be fully understood, ending the defilements is the full understanding of them, and an arahant is the one who has achieved this.
